title: Superfoods & Nutrition
description: How much do you know about superfoods and their nutritional benefits?

questions.question: Which berry is often called a superfood due to its extremely high antioxidant content?
questions.explanation: Blueberries are considered one of the top superfoods due to their high levels of anthocyanins and other antioxidants that may help protect against cell damage.

questions.question: Quinoa is often praised as a superfood because it is a complete protein. Where did it originate?
questions.explanation: Quinoa originated in the Andean region of South America, where it was cultivated by the Inca Empire and called 'the mother of all grains.'

questions.question: Which leafy green vegetable contains more iron per calorie than beef?
questions.explanation: Spinach contains about 3.6 mg of iron per 100 grams cooked, making it one of the most iron-rich vegetables per calorie.

questions.question: What superfood spice gives curry its yellow color and contains curcumin?
questions.explanation: Turmeric contains curcumin, a compound with powerful anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. It has been used in traditional medicine for thousands of years.

questions.question: Which nut is the richest source of omega-3 fatty acids?
questions.explanation: Walnuts are the richest tree nut source of alpha-linolenic acid (ALA), a plant-based omega-3 fatty acid that supports heart health.

questions.question: Acai berries are native to which region?
questions.explanation: Acai berries grow on acai palm trees native to the Amazon rainforest in Brazil. They are rich in antioxidants, fiber, and heart-healthy fats.

questions.question: Which seed is one of the best plant sources of omega-3 fatty acids?
questions.explanation: Chia seeds are exceptionally rich in omega-3 fatty acids, fiber, and protein. They were a staple food of the ancient Aztecs and Mayans.

questions.question: What makes salmon a superfood?
questions.explanation: Salmon is rich in omega-3 fatty acids (EPA and DHA), which support heart health, brain function, and reduce inflammation.

questions.question: Which superfood grain is naturally gluten-free and was a staple of the Aztec empire?
questions.explanation: Amaranth is a gluten-free pseudocereal that was a primary food source for the Aztecs. It is high in protein, fiber, and micronutrients.

questions.question: Dark chocolate is considered a superfood primarily because it is rich in what?
questions.explanation: Dark chocolate is rich in flavonoids, particularly flavanols, which have antioxidant properties and may help lower blood pressure and improve blood flow.

questions.question: Which green superfood powder is made from young barley or wheat plants?
questions.explanation: Wheatgrass is harvested from the young shoots of the wheat plant and is rich in chlorophyll, vitamins, and minerals.

questions.question: Which superfood is a type of blue-green algae sold as a dietary supplement?
questions.explanation: Spirulina is a blue-green algae that is extremely high in protein and rich in B vitamins, iron, and antioxidants. NASA has studied it as a potential food for space missions.

questions.question: Which fruit has the highest potassium content per serving?
questions.explanation: Avocados contain more potassium per serving than bananas, with about 975 mg per avocado compared to 422 mg in a banana.

questions.question: Kale became widely popular as a superfood in the 2010s. What family of vegetables does it belong to?
questions.explanation: Kale belongs to the cruciferous (Brassica) family, along with broccoli, Brussels sprouts, and cabbage. These vegetables contain compounds linked to cancer prevention.

questions.question: Which superfood is the world's most consumed cooking oil and comes from the fruit of a tropical palm?
questions.explanation: Coconut oil, derived from the coconut palm, has been promoted as a superfood for its medium-chain triglycerides (MCTs), though its health benefits remain debated.
